reasoning_log: The matching process involved categorizing images into Living/Dining (L/D), Kitchen (K), Bedroom (B), and Bathroom (Ba) groups. Ambiguities within the L/D and B categories were resolved using specific visual cues mentioned in the tags. For L/D, Image_1 was chosen for the '開放式格局' (open layout) showing the kitchen connection, while Image_11 was chosen for '客餐分區明確' (clear separation) due to the prominent decorative feature wall. For Bedrooms, Image_5 was uniquely identified by the built-in desk area, Image_10 by the large sliding wardrobe ('大容量衣櫃'), and Image_6 was assigned the lowest light rating ('採光一般') due to its smaller window size compared to Image_4. Kitchens were differentiated by the presence and perspective of the bar counter (Image_13 vs. Image_14) and the standard galley layout with a back door (Image_3). Bathrooms were easily separated by the unique patterned tile in Image_7 versus the minimalist design in Image_8. All 14 descriptions were matched 1:1 to the 14 images.

matching_result_list.evidence: Open layout (開放式格局) showing the seamless connection between the living area, dining area, and the entrance to the kitchen/utility space.

extracted_feature.raw_description: 採光佳(落地門窗面向外景), 連接陽台(推門可出陽台晾曬), 動線流暢(客廳到餐桌區一條線), 家具擺位彈性(長方形空間好規劃), 獨立餐桌區(適合家庭與聚會), 燈光均勻(天花崁燈+餐吊燈)

matching_result_list.evidence: Living/Dining area connected to a large sliding door/balcony (連接陽台), providing good natural light and flow.
